item.title: First Republic Bank Is Seized and Bulk Sold to JPMorgan
item.description: The deal will see JPMorgan take on all of First Republic’s $103.9 billion in deposits and buy most of its $229.1 billion in assets. It heads off a chaotic collapse that threatened to reignite the recent banking crisis.

item.title: Crude Oil Slips Amid Worries Over Consumer Demand
item.description: Crude-oil futures were around 1% lower, with Goldman Sachs saying worries over consumption could be seen in the distillates market, noting a sharp selloff from roughly $45 a barrel post-Ukrain war to the mid-teens in dollars.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.9%, Led by Electronics Stocks Losses
item.description: The Nikkei ended 0.9% higher, led by gains in electronics stocks after the Bank of Japan’s decision to maintain its easing policy led the yen to weaken to a seven-week low.

item.title: Having a Name Twin at Work Is Hard, Just Ask Chris Smith. And Chris Smith.
item.description: You’re getting a promotion! Or are you? Work doppelgängers are everywhere.

item.title: Having a Name Twin at Work Is Hard, Just Ask Chris Smith. And Chris Smith.

item.title: Petitioners are arguing before India's Supreme Court for the expansion of marriage rights to millions of LGBTQ people, but face opposition from the country's socially conservative government.
item.description: Petitioners are arguing before India’s Supreme Court for the expansion of marriage rights to millions of LGBTQ people, but face opposition from the country’s socially conservative government.

item.title: Florida Gov. DeSantis is poised to jump into the Republican presidential primary in the coming months with an $86 million pot of donor money and a legally questionable strategy for using it.
item.description: Florida Gov. DeSantis is poised to jump into the Republican presidential primary in the coming months with an $86 million pot of donor money and a legally questionable strategy for using it.

item.title: China is resisting a U.S. push to build more-reliable systems for communicating in a crisis, raising the risk that a miscalculation by either side's military could spill into conflict.
item.description: China is resisting a U.S. push to build more-reliable systems for communicating in a crisis, raising the risk that a miscalculation by either side’s military could spill into conflict.

item.title: Texas law enforcement expanded its search over the weekend for a suspected gunman accused of fatally shooting five people, including an 8-year-old child.
item.description: Texas law enforcement expanded its search over the weekend for a suspected gunman accused of fatally shooting five people, including an 8-year-old child.

item.title: Netanyahu said he is committed to reaching a compromise over a proposed overhaul of Israel's judiciary, even as he comes under increasing pressure from elements within his own government to advance the legislation.
item.description: Netanyahu said he is committed to reaching a compromise over a proposed overhaul of Israel’s judiciary, even as he comes under increasing pressure from elements within his own government to advance the legislation.

item.title: House Speaker McCarthy won the preliminary round in his effort to lead Republicans into debt-ceiling negotiations, but Democrats said the provisions of the GOP legislation weren't a real offer.
item.description: House Speaker McCarthy won the preliminary round in his effort to lead Republicans into debt-ceiling negotiations, but Democrats said the provisions of the GOP legislation weren’t a real offer.

item.title: China's party-state, long steeped in secrecy, is creating a black box around information on the world's second-largest economy, alarming global businesses and investors.
item.description: China’s party-state, long steeped in secrecy, is creating a black box around information on the world’s second-largest economy, alarming global businesses and investors.

item.title: Adidas will focus on sports, doubling "down on all of the things that are U.S.-centric" to boost its stateside business, the company's North America president said in an interview.
item.description: Adidas will focus on sports, doubling “down on all of the things that are U.S.-centric” to boost its stateside business, the company’s North America president said in an interview.

item.title: SpaceX anticipates spending about $2 billion on its Starship rocket program this year and might not need to raise additional outside funding, CEO Elon Musk said in an audio chat on Twitter.
item.description: SpaceX anticipates spending about $2 billion on its Starship rocket program this year and might not need to raise additional outside funding, CEO Elon Musk said in an audio chat on Twitter.

item.title: Apple, Marriott and Starbucks are among the companies that will report quarterly results in coming days, offering a closer look at consumer-spending habits in a slowing economy.
item.description: Apple, Marriott and Starbucks are among the companies that will report quarterly results in coming days, offering a closer look at consumer-spending habits in a slowing economy.

item.title: Revlon Inc. will emerge from bankruptcy under new ownership and a new board of directors that includes former executives from Bloomin' Brands, Sephora and Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.
item.description: Revlon Inc. will emerge from bankruptcy under new ownership and a new board of directors that includes former executives from Bloomin’ Brands, Sephora and Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc.

item.title: Shares of large U.S. technology companies are powering the broader market higher again, vindicating many individual investors who placed big bets on growth stocks.
item.description: Shares of large U.S. technology companies are powering the broader market higher again, vindicating many individual investors who placed big bets on growth stocks.

item.title: The building boom has helped push unemployment to around its lowest level in more than 50 years, perplexing investors who want to see the Fed switch course on interest rates.
